newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Qantas to spend A$550m on upgrades.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Qantas to spend A$550m on upgrades.

text.p: Qantas Airways Ltd said on Thursday it would spend more than A$550 million over the next three years to make changes to its products and services.
Qantas chief executive James Strong said the company's aim was to ensure Qantas remained a leader in world aviation through to the year 2000 and beyond.

"We will be outlining the details of the concept to our customers via television and print advertising under the banner, Flying Towards 2000, branded with a new promotional logo designed to emphasise the dynamic nature of the change within Qantas," Strong said in a statement.
Qantas said the interiors of its entire fleet would be refurbished with high technology seating and amenities.
The company said the reconfiguration of its international fleet would commence in April and the domestic fleet in October.
Qantas said it would continue to increase spending on engineering, maintenance and inventory of spare and replacement items to underpin its reputation for performance and reliability.
Qantas' major shareholder is British Airways Plc with a 25 percent stake.
